Outcome.DescriptionText: On the approach your troops notice that there is no sign of any life for miles. Everything is dead. Closer to the tomb there are signs of battle, aged weapons and armor littering the ground. As they are almost at the tomb, skeletons begin pouring out. The platoon immediately fire several rockets. The shots hit the intended target. The tomb explodes and collapses into itself, most of the skeletons are crushed under the debris. A couple have survived, your troops engage them.

Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and quickly find evidence of Remnant activity. As they explore further they discover a still operational hangar bay. Your troops trip the automated security sensors and the entire Remnant fleet that was stationed here powers up and flies into orbit.
Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. The artifacts and other curiosities found there will sell well on the open market.

Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. The tomb has been littered with unfathomable amounts of degraded materials. It seems that the customs of said civilization were to bury their dead nobles with all their possessions. These may have been their treasures, but how can we resist using them now? They still have some value.

Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. Inside the tomb, they find exotic minerals, and from what they can gather, they were formed from the corpses of an ancient race that had a very unique molecular physiology.

After Scouting the area inside the tomb, your troops found an altar, with working holo-chip containing schematics of unknown technology. After removing it from altar the Tomb starts to shake and the room fills up with sand, alarming dormant ground and space defenders.
Outcome.ConfirmText: We are trapped on this planet!

Outcome.DescriptionText: Your forces enter the mysterious tomb and find evidence of a long dead civilization. The complex is incredibly well preserved. Yet even more curious is the fact that this site seems to have been the target of an earlier archaeological expedition by a second alien race -- very likely starfarers based on the evidence found. \n \n The wealth of information presented here will pay dividends to our scientists for years to come. Your race gains a 3% bonus to all scientific efforts for the discovery.
